ref: 5622 tagara1 n. ʻ the shrub Tabernaemontana coronaria and a fragrant powder obtained from it ʼ Kauś., ˚aka<-> VarBr̥S. [Cf. sthagara -- , sthakara -- n. ʻ a partic. fragrant powder ʼ TBr.]

lang: Gāndhārī or Northwest Prakrit (as recorded in the Dharmapada ed. J. Brough, Oxford 1962)

ref: Pk. tagara -- , ṭayara -- m. ʻ a kind of tree, a kind of scented wood ʼ;
Si. tuvara, tōra ʻ a species of Cassia plant. ʼ
